issue.title: [ENH] refactoring `test_all_classifiers` to test class architecture

labels.name: refactor
labels.description: Restructuring without changing its external behavior. Neither fixing a bug nor adding a feature.

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR changes `test_all_classifiers` to the test class architecture.

The main change is moving the tests into a class inheriting from `BaseFixtureGenerator` and `QuickTester`.

Changes that deserve special note:
* `test_3d_numpy_input` was removed - this is redundant with `test_methods_do_not_change_state` since that already runs the methods with 3D `numpy` input (using the scenario `ClassifierFitPredict`)
* 100-times copy-pasted tests on unit test and basic motions data were moved to the test suite. This has been carried out for only two instances in this PR since it's tedious. Opened #2255 for doing the rest.
* added multivariate scenario for classifiers. This allows to move the positive case from `test_multivariate_input`, because `test_all_estimators` covers that. Hence, now only the negative (exception raising) case is tested as `test_multivariate_input_exception`.

body:
Hm, not a bad idea, @MatthewMiddlehurst.
Although I worry it will be more difficult on implementers.

How would the implementation pattern look like?
Changing from a list to a dict?

issue.title: [ENH] Centralise correctness testing for classification

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
all the classifiers run correctness sanity tests using predict and predict_proba for the UnitTest problem as a check against changes introducing logical errors to the algorithms. This is currently done with replicated code in each sub package. It would be good to centralise this in a single place and remove duplicate code. Several stages to this

1. Regenerating correct outputs. Sometimes algorithms will change in an approved way, and output may change. Code to generate new correct output is currently commented out. Stage 1 of this issue will be to strip out commented code and dump it in contrib for noew
2. What tests to perform? We can review existing and decide on how best to test any classifier
3. How to do a generic test and where to put it and the correct results? this will basically integrate (1) and (2) above

body:
ah! I see.
Your variant is much more downwards compatible, since you can simply ignore the `parameter_set` argument.

I'd be happy with you adding the `parameter_set` parameter in `BaseObject` with a default of `"default"`, and having two sets for classifiers (this must be explained in the docstrings of course, so you may want to override the default in `BaseClassifier` with a docstring that explains `"result_comparison"`).
All the classifiers have been updated. The remaining ones are moving to a different base class and set of tests.

that´s the thresholder and teaser, right?
Should there then an issue for moving them, and this can close?
I was planning to update them both after the base class is in, shouldn't need a new issue.
ok, so let's track them in this issue then and then close?
